conclusion: Cars A and B are traveling in the same direction on a straight road.
Their v-t graphs are shown in the figure.
It is known that the two cars are side by side at t=30s.
The task is to determine the maximum distance between Car A and Car B between the two instances when they are side by side.
The graph shows the velocity of Car A and Car B over time.
Car A has a constant velocity of 40 m/s from t=0 to t=30 s.
Car B has a velocity of 4t m/s from t=0 to t=20 s and then a constant velocity of 80 m/s from t=20 to t=30 s.
Integrate the velocity to find the position function for both cars.
For Car A, the position function is s_A(t) = 40t.
For Car B, the position function is s_B(t) = 2t^2 from t=0 to t=20 s and s_B(t) = 800 + 80(t-20) from t=20 to t=30 s.
At t=30 s, both cars are side by side, so their positions are equal.
The maximum distance between the two cars occurs at the point where the positions of the cars are farthest apart before they meet again.
The maximum distance is 0 m at t=20 s.
The maximum distance between Car A and Car B between the two instances when they are side by side is 0 m.
